feed.title: The Reading Dimension
feed.subtitle: Welcome to my own little corner of the web! Here, I muse about a variety of topics, mostly tech-related, but I also dabble in others like anime, manga, writing, and gaming as well! (•‿•)

entry.title: Taking Inkdown for a Spin!
entry.summary:
As I said back in an earlier post, I decided to go back to Markdown for all my notes. I use VS Code as my Markdown editor of choice for writing these posts and taking notes, but I recently learned about a new Markdown notetaking app that caught my interest, so I’ve decided to take it for a spin!
The app is called Inkdown and is by far the best Markdown notetaking app I have the pleasure of usi...

entry.title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Is Making Me Feel Optimistic About This Series Again!

link.title: Pokémon Legends Z-A Is Making Me Feel Optimistic About This Series Again!

entry.summary: Pokémon Day came and went and left us with a new trailer for the upcoming Pokémon Legends Z-A, and I have some thoughts on it.

entry.title: What I Learned From Org-Mode and Why I Returned to Markdown.

link.title: What I Learned From Org-Mode and Why I Returned to Markdown.

entry.summary: I've been tinkering with Org-Mode for a while now; my search for more productivity tools led me to it, and I instantly fell in love with how it handles task management!

entry.title: My Device Naming Scheme
entry.summary: I have always found it fascinating what others name their computers and devices. Just like finding funny and unique Wi-Fi names, it is a small window into someone's interests and personality. So allow me to share my own!

entry.title: Finally Moved Over To Jekyll Chirpy!

link.title: Finally Moved Over To Jekyll Chirpy!

entry.summary: After much deliberation on my part and messing around with different themes, I finally decided to go with the Jekyll Chirpy theme!
